conclusion: The problem involves a detector moving along the positive direction of the x-axis with a velocity inversely proportional to its displacement.
The velocity at point A is 4 m/s and at point B is 2 m/s.
The displacement from point O to point B is 2 m.
The velocity is inversely proportional to the displacement, which can be expressed as \\( v = \frac{k}{x} \\).
The constant \\( k \\) is found to be 4.
The time taken to travel from point A to point B is calculated using the integral of \\( dt = \frac{dx}{v} \\).
The integral is evaluated as \\( \int_{1}^{2} \frac{x}{4} \, dx \\).
The time \\( T \\) is calculated as \\( \frac{1}{4} \times 1.5 \\), resulting in 0.375 seconds.
The time it takes for the detector to move from point A to point B is 0.375 seconds.
